author: Elvia Limon
description: The Ukrainian ambassador to the U.S. on Sunday said “all of Ukraine prays” for the Friday meeting between President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin to be “effective and to have great results.” “So yes, we want Putin to stop, and we really are hopeful that this push from President Trump, and the sanction packages which…
title: Ukrainian ambassador to the US: Ukraine ‘prays’ for Trump-Putin meeting to ‘be effective’

author: Tara Suter
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Sunday that his country will not let Russia “deceive” the U.S. as a meeting between President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin looms. “Of course, our team is working with the United States — not a single day goes by without communication on how to ensure real peace. We understand…
title: Zelensky: We will not let Russia ‘deceive’ US

author: Tara Suter
description: Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.) said Sunday that Russian President Vladimir Putin “can’t tolerate” going “after his customers” ahead of an Alaska meeting between Putin and President Trump. “Putin could give a damn about sanctions. He evades them. He could give a damn about how many Russians die. The one thing that he can’t tolerate and…
title: Graham: Putin ‘can’t tolerate’ going ‘after his customers’

author: Amalia Huot-Marchand
description: Vice President JD Vance on Sunday accused the Biden administration of refusing to release files on Jeffrey Epstein because of the financier’s connections to Democrats. “We know that Jeffrey Epstein had a lot of connections with left-wing politicians and left-wing billionaires … Democrat billionaires and Democrat political leaders went to Epstein island all the time.…
title: Vance: ‘We know’ Epstein had ‘connections with left-wing’ politicians, billionaires

author: Tara Suter
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Sunday that Israel has “no choice” but to escalate its offensive in Gaza as his country faces heightened criticism for its conduct amid the war in the territory. “Given Hamas’s refusal to lay down its arms, Israel has no choice but to finish the job and complete the defeat…
title: Netanyahu: Israel has ‘no choice’ but to escalate Gaza offensive

author: Amalia Huot-Marchand
description: Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker (D) said Sunday it would be illegal for President Trump to order the FBI to arrest Texas state Democratic officials for fleeing their state to halt Republican redistricting efforts. “Well, first of all, Texas law does not apply in the state of Illinois, and there’s no federal law that would allow…
title: Pritzker on GOP’s FBI arrest threats: ‘Texas law does not apply’ in Illinois

author: Sylvan Lane
description: President Trump spoke Sunday with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu as Israel and its leader face rising global backlash over its plan to expand military control of the Gaza Strip. Netanyahu’s office announced the call in a post on social media, saying the leaders “discussed Israel’s plans for taking control of the remaining Hamas strongholds…
title: Trump, Netanyahu speak as Israel faces backlash over Gaza plan

author: Tara Suter
description: Former Attorney General Eric Holder said Sunday the FBI does not have jurisdiction to return Texas Democratic lawmakers who fled their state. “Texas lawmakers are digging in. You heard Governor Abbott there talking about the FBI, Senator Cornyn calling the FBI to help locate those Democratic lawmakers who fled the state. I wonder, do you…
title: Former attorney general says FBI can’t return Texas lawmakers who fled state

author: Amalia Huot-Marchand
description: President Trump signaled he was ramping up plans to address violence and crime in Washington, D.C., reiterating he would have a news conference at the White House on Monday, adding, “There will be no ‘Mr. Nice Guy.’ “I’m going to make our Capital safer and more beautiful than it ever was before. The Homeless have…
title: Trump on DC crime crackdown: ‘There will be no ‘Mr. Nice Guy’

author: Rachel Scully
description: Former national security adviser John Bolton, a vocal critic of President Trump’s foreign policy decisions, said the president “wants the Nobel Peace Prize more than anything else,” adding that “the way to his heart,” which he said leaders like Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu have discovered, is to offer to nominate him. While discussing Trump’s recent…
title: Bolton says Trump ‘wants a Nobel Peace Prize more than anything else’

author: Amalia Huot-Marchand
description: U.S. NATO Ambassador Matthew Whitaker said President Trump will have to “trust but verify” Russian President Vladimir Putin during their meeting in Alaska on Friday, where they plan to hold talks about ending the war with Ukraine. On CNN’s “State of the Union” with Dana Bash, Whitaker said if the world leaders reach a deal,…
title: NATO ambassador: Trump will ‘trust but verify’ Putin in Alaska

author: Amalia Huot-Marchand
description: Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) on Sunday shrugged off the idea of Vice President Vance being the likely Republican frontrunner for the 2028 presidential elections. “Neither Trump, nor he nor the Republicans of today have anything of significance to say to working class people,” he said on CNN’s State of the Union with Dana Bash.  “Doesn’t…
title: Sanders shrugs off Vance as possible MAGA successor: ‘Doesn’t matter to me who heads the Republican Party’

author: Mark R. Whittington, opinion contributor
description: As able as he is, the situation cries out for a permanent NASA administrator, someone with the respect of both President Trump and the Congress.
title: Sean Duffy is doing his a great job at NASA, but it might not be enough

author: Amalia Huot-Marchand
description: Dr. Phil McGraw called the President Trump-led national redistricting war “Bulls—” during an interview with Comedian Bill Maher.  McGraw, during a Friday interview on HBO’s “Real Time with Bill Maher,”  debated with Maher around the fact that redistricting is done by both Democrats and Republicans, as well as between censuses.  “Texas is doing it because they say…
title: Bill Maher, Dr. Phil weigh in on Trump’s redistricting fight: ‘Bulls—’

author: Ahmad Shah Habibi, opinion contributor
description: Another year has passed and my brother, Mahmood Habibi, remains in Taliban custody.
title: CIA must pull its weight to free Mahmood Habibi in Afghanistan

author: Glenn C. Altschuler and David Wippman, opinion contributors
description: American institutions of higher education should act as well as react to this crisis.
title: Even if they settle with Trump, universities have their work cut out for them

author: Rachel Scully
description: Hundreds of thousands of protesters flooded the streets of Israel, including Tel Aviv and Jerusalem, on Saturday night to call for the release of the remaining hostages and object to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s plan to expand military control of the Gaza Strip, which escalates the war. In Tel Aviv, an estimated 100,000 people marched to demand…
title: Thousands in Israel protest Netanyahu Gaza plan, call for release of hostages

author: Filip Timotija
description: Rep. Ralph Norman (R-S.C.) acknowledged that the public is seeing higher prices as a result of tariffs imposed by President Trump, but argued the trade overhaul is “for the good of the country.”  “I think a lot of people are seeing higher prices. Our family’s in the construction business, and we get a lot of…
title: South Carolina Republican: High prices are ‘for the good of the country’

author: Filip Timotija
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin’s reported proposal for a ceasefire in Ukraine, which would require Kyiv to cede regions in the east, sparked a firm response from European leaders on Saturday ahead of President Trump’s summit with the Kremlin leader in Alaska next week.  The seven European leaders welcomed Trump’s efforts to negotiate a ceasefire as…
title: Putin’s Ukraine land pitch sparks firm European response ahead of Trump summit

author: Russell Falcon
description: "Your pronouns are has/been.”
title: Dean Cain a ‘loser’ for joining ICE: John Leguizamo
